snippet.textDisplay:
As a red, I want Everton to do well (but one place below us).
My mates back home are blues. I care.

Here is how I saw it: our kids were not as good as the Everton players but our kids were acting their hearts out. If you watch our first team you see corner to corner cross pitch passes that are accurate to inches, you see forward and sideway passes in a box that are accurate and lead to goals: these kids didn't have all that talent. But we also have a team where everyone is humble and gives giving 100%: these kids had that. You got the ball, you were swarmed by reds. We were winning and still put pressure on your goaly, running at him in pairs when he had the ball.
The kids weren't great, at times tripping over each other, but they played and played and played. Everton were happy to sit back when they didn't have the ball.

You are right, a championship team would have won.

It's how Everton got so close to the relegation zone this year. When luck goes against you and the players can't be arsed, you drop points. When luck goes against you but you're giving 100% you nearly win the premiership, you win a 6th champions League, and a World Club Cup.

I was glad when Sunderland went down because those players had the same attitude. And if you look at the title winning Leicester team you see championship players giving 100% each game.

I was really shocked at what I saw. My dad hasn't watches the blues in ages and he couldn't believe it.

snippet.textDisplay: Sensible and realistic comments, the type of which I have been making to my Evertonian friends and family this past 12 months. A good clear out is definitely on the cards and Ancelotti will get that job done, don't worry about it, you finally have the right manager. It was a rude awakening for him and he's probably thinking 'Dio! È molto peggio di quanto pensassi!' ('God! It's much worse than I thought!'). I think this will be a turning point for Everton and the only way is up - there's a big hill in front of you and it will take years but you'll get there. As someone else said, 'I'm old school too' and always want Liverpool to have the 2 best teams in the world (us first like! lol). Good luck Toffees #NilSatisNisiOptimum #YNWA

snippet.textDisplay: It is a truth that passion goes a long way when playing football, it was devoid in one team and overflowing in the other, Everton had the better players, most of them internationals but they were outfought by young lads who were playing for their futures.  I have never rated Pickford and the Liverpool goalkeeper who didn't even have a team when they stumbled on him is ten times better, the blues should go after him, feel for Coleman as he was once a decent player but I don't think he has recovered from his injuries,  I have watched Charlison a few times but still cannot decide if he is a player or not, he is for politenesses sake inconsistent,  It was strange with the January window that those that want to leave would have put in a show, that those that want to stay would do the same, frankly, Carlo has a huge job deciding which of these players he could trust to put in a performance during the rest of the season,  on the evidence here he doesn't have many,  I doubt many top players if they saw this game would want to join Everton at the moment, or they would want over the top wages, sad because the fans deserve better than this, I would back my side every step of the way if I knew they were doing their best, these players seemed unconcerned and that to any fan is criminal!

snippet.textDisplay: Surely, this has to be the nadir in mine and many others lives as an Evertonian. It sucks going into work every week after a derby with all the red lot blowing their own trumpets adding insult to the ever larger wound but this will be by far the worst. I was 3 when we last won at Anfield, 14 when we last beat them and 17 when we last lead a game against them in November 2013!   Until we actually wake up and realise that we need wholesale change from top to the bottom of the club in personnel and in the culture of the club, we will continue to be in the wilderness for many years and decades to come.

snippet.textDisplay: Bees fan (Brentford)here. Fair play to you for facing the music, can't be easy to come here and to talk about your team no-show performance today. Speaking as a neutral and having watched the game, I think you were 100% spot on, some of your players ARE a disgrace to the shirt; however, you said one thing that I suppose all Evertonians must be feeling; the fact that Jurgen Klopp was cheeky enough to play a team of youngsters - 6 of whom were under the age of 21, in a Merseyside derby, plus one or two fringe players, and still managed beat you was in my view truly insulting and humiliating - Klopp knew exactly what he was doing and he purposely knew how catastrophic and crushing it would be for Evertonians everywhere, especially losing to your bitter inexperienced rivals. No doubt the next few days will be unbearable for the blue side of Merseyside, but things will get better. Good luck in your future as I'm more than certain Ancelotti WILL put things right in the next year or so.
